SENT.plain: Neocarzinostatin (NCS) induces repair in a xeroderma pigmentosum lymphoblastoid line deficient in the ability to repair DNA damage induced with (acetoxyacetyl-amino)fluorene
Repair was demonstrated by the induction of repair synthesis and by the disappearance of NCS-induced single-strand breaks and/or alkaline-labile sites in DNA

Estimation of NCS-induced repair patch size, based on the density shift induced in DNA by extensive shear after incubation of treated cells in medium with bromodeoxyuridine or by calculation from the extent of restoration of DNA sedimentation profiles in alkaline sucrose gradients and the amount of repair synthesis measured by the BND cellulose method, indicated that only a few nucleotides were inserted per repaired region
NCS-treated bacteriophage T7 DNA requires incubation with alkaline phosphatase to make it a substrate for DNA polymerase I
NCS-reacted T7 DNA, even after phosphatase treatment, is not a substrate for a DNA polymerase alpha obtained from human lymphoma cells
NCS-treated T7 DNA did serve as a substrate for the DNA polymerase alpha when incubated with an apurinic/apyrimidinic (AP) endonuclease with associated 5'-3'-exonuclease activity
The results suggest that NCS-induced AP sites could be intermediates for the in vivo repair synthesis
